title: considering the date specified in the following order appropriate having regard
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Civil Law (Miscellaneous Provisions)
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Civil Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) 

Act 2022 (Section 4(2)) (Scheme Termination Date) Order 2024.
text_norm: 1 order may cited civil law (miscellaneous provisions) act 2022 (section 4(2)) (scheme termination date) order 2024

title: considering the date specified in the following order appropriate having regard
heading: 2. The date referred to in the definition of “scheme termination date” in
text_raw:
2. The date referred to in the definition of “scheme termination date” in 
section 4(1) of the Civil Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2022 shall be 31 
March 2025. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

11 March, 2024. 

RODERIC O’GORMAN, 

Minister for Children, Equality, Disability, Integration and 
Youth. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 12th March, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [94] 3
text_norm: 2 date referred definition scheme termination date section 4(1) civil law (miscellaneous provisions) act 2022 shall 31 march 2025 given official seal 11 march 2024 roderic gorman minister child equality disability integration youth notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 12th march 2024 94 3

title: considering the date specified in the following order appropriate having regard
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order amends the Civil Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2022 to 
extend the scheme termination date for the financial contribution for hosting 
temporary protection beneficiaries to 31 March 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [94]
